articles.title: Coronavirus Update: WHO Confirms over 2,000 COVID-19 Fatalities as Two Quarantined Cruise Ship Passengers Die
articles.description: The Diamond Princess passengers were taken to hospital after showing symptoms of the coronavirus.
articles.content:
Over 2,000 people have died of the new coronavirusincluding two former passengers of a quarantined cruise shipin more than 75,000 cases, according to health officials.

articles.author: Soo Kim
articles.title: Asia Flight Prices Drop as Coronavirus Fears Discourage People From Traveling
articles.description: Several airlines are offering lower prices for flights to Asia, while others have reduced their services to the region due to falling demand.
articles.content:
Airlines have been struggling to fill plane seats for flights to Asia, with fears over the coronavirus deterring people from traveling. Some carriers are offering lower fares to various major cities in Japan, Thailand, Singapore, and South Korea.
The deadly … [+3550 chars]

articles.author: Soo Kim
articles.title: Is the Cruise Ship Coronavirus Quarantine Working? Scientist Says Close Confinement Is a 'Recipe for Transmission'
articles.description: More than half of those reported infected outside China were aboard the Diamond Princess cruise ship, which has been quarantined in Japan for over two weeks.
articles.content: Quarantines in confined spaces, such as a cruise ship or hotel, may make people more prone to contracting the COVID-19 coronavirus. Concentrated levels of exposure, closer contact in shared spaces and the possible spreading of the virus through the air condit… [+8057 chars]

articles.author: Jenni Fink
articles.title: 547 Additional Coronavirus Cases Confirmed, the Smallest Increase in 25 Days
articles.description: "We're encouraged by this trend but it's no time for complacency," said WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus.
articles.content:
The number of COVID-19 cases increased by 547 overnight, the lowest daily rise in cases of the potentially fatal virus in 25 days.
WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus acknowledged a slight slowing in the number of diagnoses in an update call … [+3696 chars]

articles.content:
Scientists in China have raised concerns the new coronavirus, named COVID-19, may affect male fertility. However, an expert in the field has stressed to Newsweek that men should not be worried.

articles.title: Coronavirus Could Push Companies to Stop Relying on China, But It's Easier Said Than Done, Experts Say
articles.description: Moving supply chains out of China has been discussed for years, but removing China from the equation entirely is easier said than done.
articles.content:
